What is the purpose of the `setidentitytimelock` command in Verus?
The `setidentitytimelock` command is used to set a time unlock delay, set a lock until a specific block height, or unlock a delayed timelock on a VerusID under your control.

## New Command and API for Verus Vault - setidentitytimelock
v0.9.0-2 introduces a new command and RPC API, "setidentitytimelock". setidentitytimelock may be used to set a time unlock delay, set a lock until a specific block height, or unlock a delayed timelock on a VerusID under your control.You can use setidentitytimelock in one of two ways:
```
verus setidentitytimelock '{"unlockatblock":1796500}' (returntx)
```
or
```
verus setidentitytimelock '{"setunlockdelay":1440}' (returntx)
```
or
```
verus setidentitytimelock '{"unlockatblock":0}' (returntx)
```
The first example will lock the ID until the block specified. If the block specified is in the past, the ID will not be locked.
The second example will set a 1440 block unlock delay, which will be needed to wait before spending funds controlled by the ID after unlocking the ID (about one day unlock time).
The third example will unlock an ID that has been locked with an unlock delay, and the unlock time will be set to the block height at which the ID was unlocked + the originally set unlock delay.
./raw_text_input_wiki/release_notes.md
How can I use the `setidentitytimelock` command to lock a VerusID until a specific block height?

You can use the `setidentitytimelock` command to lock a VerusID until a specific block height by specifying the block height in the `unlockatblock` parameter. For example:
```
verus setidentitytimelock '{"unlockatblock":1796500}' (returntx)
```
This will lock the ID until the specified block height. If the block specified is in the past, the ID will not be locked.

How can I use the `setidentitytimelock` command to set an unlock delay on a VerusID?

You can use the `setidentitytimelock` command to set an unlock delay on a VerusID by specifying the delay in blocks in the `setunlockdelay` parameter. For example:
```
verus setidentitytimelock '{"setunlockdelay":1440}' (returntx)
```
This will set a 1440 block unlock delay, which means that you will need to wait for 1440 blocks before spending funds controlled by the ID after unlocking the ID.

How can I use the `setidentitytimelock` command to unlock a VerusID that has been locked with an unlock delay?

You can use the `setidentitytimelock` command to unlock a VerusID that has been locked with an unlock delay by setting `unlockatblock` to 0. For example:
```
verus setidentitytimelock '{"unlockatblock":0}' (returntx)
```
This will unlock the ID, and the unlock time will be set to the block height at which the ID was unlocked + the originally set unlock delay.
